question: What is a 'drop zone', and when might you use it?*

choices.text: A section of the course designed only for dropping off golf carts.
An area where you can drop your ball near a hazard.
Its where you need to stand when your partner is hitting their shot.
An area where you should drop your ball if it finished in a G.U.R. area.

explanation: Sometimes drop zones are provided as an extra relief option. This might be when there it is difficult to take relief in the normal way, or as a way for the greens staff to get you to play from a certain part of the course when it is being repaired.
